name: Dark Charizard

attacks.name: Continuous Fireball
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads. Discard a number of Fire Energy cards attached to Dark Charizard equal to the number of heads.

flavorText: Seemingly possessed, it spews fire like a volcano, trying to burn all it sees.

strengths: Continuous Fireball can deal massive damage with good coin flips
Potential for 200+ damage in ideal scenarios
Nail Flick provides cheap early game option
weaknesses: Discards energy equal to heads, making follow-up attacks difficult
80 HP is low for a Stage 2
counters: Blastoise - Water type with Rain Dance

competitiveHistory: Dark Charizard was a fan-favorite collector card but saw minimal competitive play due to its unreliable Continuous Fireball attack. The coin flip mechanic made damage output wildly inconsistent - you could deal 0 damage or 200+ damage on the same turn. The energy discard on heads also made it unsustainable. Competitively, the original Base Set Charizard's guaranteed 100 damage was generally preferred despite its own drawbacks.

rulings.ruling: You flip coins equal to the number of Fire Energy cards, not the amount of Fire Energy provided. Double Colorless Energy doesn't count.
You must discard Fire Energy cards equal to the number of heads, even if it means discarding all your Fire Energy.
If you flip all tails, the attack does 0 damage and you discard no energy.
You choose which Fire Energy cards to discard if you have more than the required amount.
